titleInfo.title: Leroy Sullivan correspondence with Grady Long, 1943 April 17

mods.abstract: Letter from Leroy Sullivan to Grady Long in which Sullivan reports that he has been flying Hurricane fighter planes in combat. Sullivan mentions seeing Catharine Curtis, presumably an acquaitance from Chattanooga, who is working with the American Red Cross in Cardiff, Wales. Sullivan also wonders about what he will do after the war, debating returning to school or pursuing a career as a pilot or fireman. Sullivan offers his opinion of A. E. Housman and other authors and the Qu'ran. He concludes by describing his search for a mutual friend, Chad, on ships in Alexandria, Suez, and Cape Town.
